meanings.definition: Firmly fixed, supported, or balanced; not shaking or moving.
meanings.sent1: The table was the steadiest when all four legs were firmly on the ground.
meanings.sent2: She walked with the steadiest pace, never stumbling or swaying.
meanings.sent3: The steadiest tree in the forest was the one that never danced in the wind.
meanings.sent4: His heart beat the steadiest rhythm, like a drum keeping time.
meanings.sent5: The steadiest hands in the room belonged to the surgeon, never faltering during surgery.

meanings.definition: Constant in feeling, principle, purpose, or attachment; faithful; firm; constant; as, a steady friend, adherent, or lover.
meanings.sent1: She was the steadiest friend, always there when needed.
meanings.sent2: Their love remained the steadiest through all the ups and downs.
meanings.sent3: The steadiest supporter of the team was the mascot, never missing a game.
meanings.sent4: His voice was the steadiest anchor in the chaos of the protest.
meanings.sent5: The steadiest belief she held was in the power of kindness to change the world.
